result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob M Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

1 day of jail credit if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob M Peterson

records.addlTxt:
9:58 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob M Peterson appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Jacob M Peterson. Agreement has been reached. Defendant waives right to personal appearance and court accepts waiver. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

State moves to amend Count 1: Felony Criminal Damage to Property Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater, Domestic Abuse to Misdemeanor Criminal Damage to Property Domestic Abuse. State moves to amend Count 2: Felony Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater, Domestic Abuse to Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse. Court accepts motion.  Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Defendant pleads No Contest to amended Count 1: Misdemeanor Criminal Damage to Property Domestic Abuse without repeater. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Defendant pleads No Contest to amended Count 2: Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse without repeater. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years probation.
Conditions of probation:
No contact with A.B.J. or her residence unless A.B.J. and agent approve in writing
Complete Domestic Abuse assessment 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Court costs on each count.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge on each count.

1 day jail credit if revoked. 

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)

9:43 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob M Peterson appeared by video via Zoom.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video via Zoom for Jacob M Peterson. Attorney Knaak states and offer was recently received and he needs time to review with the Defendant.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/03/2022 at 1:15 PM
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
